title: Is there a form for Motion to Reopen a Bankruptcy Case in orded to amend Schedule F for a pre-petition debt I forgot to include?
question: My Bankruptcy was Discharged & the case was closed approximately 6 months ago. A week ago I recieved a Writ of Execution from a Creditor I forgot to include in the Bankruptcy. Is there a Court Form fo Motion to reopen Case? If not, where can I find a sample Motion?
answers:
Assuming yours was a "no asset" case, send the creditor and/or their attorney a letter (w/copy of discharge) stating that their's was a prepetition debt and per In re Beezley, 994 F.2d 1433 (9th Cir. 1993) it is considered discharged. Additionally, now that they have notice, any further attempt to collect will be a violation of your bankruptcy discharge per 362 of the Bankruptcy Code, blah, blah, blah.

If you want to email me I'll send you a copy of my standard letter.

Good luck!


Rob Taylor
www.affordableattorneysgroup.com

In re Neilsen, 383 F.2d 922 (9th Cir. 2004) and In re Beezley, 994 F.2d 1433 (9th Cir. 1993) protect you in this situation. Like my colleague properly stated, simply send creditor copy of your notice of filing and discharge, and if they had no ground to object, they are discharged as well.

I doubt you need to do such a thing. Just because you forget to list a debtor, doesn't mean that debt was discharged. Were there any assets distributed by the trustee in your case? If not, I would simply send the creditor and their attorney a copy of the discharge order.
